cards.title: Abandoned Factory
body: Whenever an ongoing or equipment card enters a hero trash pile, the villain character target with the lowest HP regains 2HP.
When a Transport card would be destroyed, you may destroy this card instead.
cards.flavorText: Rather than handing the recovered{BR}devices over to the military, Admiral{BR}Winters kept them for a project of his{BR}own, hidden in the warehouse district.

cards.title: All Aboard
body: This card is indestructible.
At the end of the environment turn, the players may activate the Travel text of a Transport card. If they do, destroy that card at the start of the next environment turn.
cards.flavorText: “That train has something to do with{BR}the loop. Today, we're going to be on{BR}it,” Julia told the Knight. He nodded.{BR}“Remind me, which one is a train?”

cards.title: Altering History
cards.body: Whenever this card or any other environment card is destroyed, this card deals the 2 non-environment targets with the lowest HP 2 psychic damage each.
cards.flavorText: The technology in these photographs{BR}is impossibly advanced, said Reager.{BR}Taking a closer look, he added. “Can{BR}the R42 be adapted for a pilot?”

cards.title: Frightened Onlookers
body: Whenever a target is dealt 4 or more damage from a single source, this card deals itself 1 projectile damage.
At the start of the environment turn, 1 player may play a card.
cards.flavorText: As the dreadnaught's rockets blew{BR}apart the wharf, several bystanders{BR}were narrowly saved by a dashing{BR}young man of impressive strength.

cards.title: Harbor Crane
body: Whenever this card is dealt damage by a target, move it next to that target.
Increase damage dealt by the target next to this card by 1.
When this card is destroyed, it deals the target next to it 5 melee damage.
cards.flavorText: The walking dreadnought let out a{BR}roar of angry steam. Far above,{BR}Vanish called out, “I've got the high{BR}ground! Want to give up now?”

cards.title: Harkin Parish Jr.
body: When this card enters play, the hero with the highest HP must discard a card. Each other player must discard a card that shares a keyword with that card.
At the end of the environment turn, this card deals the hero target with the highest HP {H} melee damage.
cards.flavorText: The well-dressed man was blocking their{BR}exit, as more figures surrounded the{BR}heroes. “Theft is such an ugly word,” he{BR}said. “I prefer extortion.”

cards.title: Left Behind
body: Play this card next to the hero with the second lowest HP.
If the last villain character target is reduced to 0HP by a target other than that hero, or if that hero is incapacitated, they are stuck in the past and the heroes lose. [b]Game over.[/b]
cards.flavorText: Necro, silent and bloody, watched{BR}as La Paradoja Magnifica{BR}disappeared into the glowing{BR}portal in the sky. He was alone.

cards.title: Ominous Loop
body: The first time a One-shot card enters the trash each turn, move it beneath this card. Cards beneath this one are not considered in play.
At the start of the environment turn, destroy this card and put all cards beneath it into play in the order they were placed there.
cards.flavorText: “This is a new one for me,” drawled{BR}Chrono-Ranger. Maria Helena, scowling,{BR}replied, “Something here has bent time{BR}back on itself. Not good.”

cards.title: Radio Plaza
body: Play with the top card of each deck face up. Damage dealt to hero targets is irreducible.
At the start of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: Remember to tune to WC1100 for the{BR}day's important news! barked the radio.{BR}“We'll keep you informed about what's{BR}happening in beautiful Windmill City!”

cards.title: Smooth Criminal
body: Reduce damage dealt to Gangsters by 1.
At the end of the environment turn, this card deals each hero target X projectile damage, where X is 1 plus the number of Transports in play.
cards.flavorText: “Mr. Parish would like to see you,”{BR}said the woman in charge of the{BR}thugs. Deckard grinned. “Really?{BR}Does he fancy a game of cards?”

cards.title: SS Escape
body: When this card enters play, search the environment deck and trash for All Aboard and put it into play. Shuffle the environment deck and each target regains 2HP.
Travel: Each player draws a card. Each villain target regains 3HP.
cards.flavorText: Catchwater Harbor was an international{BR}melting pot. It was full of those{BR}looking to start a new life of{BR}opportunity, or in some cases, villainy.

cards.title: The Cervantes Club
body: At the end of the environment turn, 1 hero character regains X HP and discards the top X cards of their deck, where X is 1, 2, or 3.
If any One-shots were discarded this way, that player discards 2 cards, then draws a card.
cards.flavorText: “Hey, stranger,” said Mara, sitting down{BR}beside him, “drink's on me.” He gave her{BR}a confused but hopeful look. “Do I{BR}know you?” She smiled sadly. “Not yet.”

cards.title: “This just in...”
body: When this card enters play, 1 player may discard 3 cards. If no cards are discarded this way, play the top card of the villain deck.
At the end of the environment turn, destroy this card.
cards.flavorText: “...we're getting reports from all over{BR}town that people are seeing, uh,{BR}strange creatures,” the announcer{BR}whispered. “Like the one behind me now.”

cards.title: 3:10 to Overbrook
body: When this card enters play, search the environment deck and trash for All Aboard and put it into play. Shuffle the environment deck and play its top card.
Travel: Play the top card of each other deck in turn order, starting with the villain deck.
cards.flavorText: Julia looked at the clock tower as the{BR}train pulled in. “3:08,” she muttered,{BR}“always the same. This whole cursed day{BR}is the same. What is going on?”

cards.title: Unmoored Zeppelin
body: When this card enters play, search the environment deck and trash for All Aboard and put it into play. Shuffle the environment deck and this card deals each target 2 projectile damage.
Travel: Increase all damage dealt by 1 until the start of the next environment turn.
cards.flavorText: Li-Feng Airships had revolutionized the{BR}transportation industry, transforming{BR}the small harbor town into a bustling{BR}city, despite their lax safety practices.
